attributes.action: Remove known sex offenders from area where victim lives
attributes.background: Convicted child sex offenders should not be allowed in the area where their victims live. Children who are sexually assaulted suffer - reliving the incident, not being able to sleep at night and having nightmares about the sex offender coming back.
attributes.additional_details: A sex offender recently got a suspended sentence, time in rehab and 10 years on the sexual offenders register. The judge just allowed him to go home, in the same area as his victim. This is utterly unacceptable. Little children deserve not to live in fear!

attributes.action: Declare 23 June every year a national holiday - "Brexit Day".
attributes.background:
23 June 2016 was a great day in our history and our democracy. 17,410,742 people voted to - leave the biggest vote in British history for anything.

The day should be duly recognised as significant in our national calendar.

attributes.action: Make dog and cat runs planning permission exempt
attributes.background: Dog and cat runs are a grey area in the planning regulations as they are not a fixed structure, removable, and can not be considered a livable so do not come under planning rules but are also a fence and attached to or next to the house which some councils consider requiring planning permission.
attributes.additional_details: In relation to this, a conservatory, which is a livable space, a fixed structure, non removable, and increases the value of the property, does not require planning permission. This petition asks that the rules be amended to allow safe protection for our loved pets by allowing dog and cat runs extending no further that 4/5 meters from the rear wall of the original house the same as conservatories are 3/4 meters depending if the house is attached or detached.

attributes.action: Make Melrose Way in Alderley Edge safer by having a central barrier
attributes.background:
Melrose Way in Alderley Edge is a new road that has seen many casualties, resulting in numerous fatalities. 
This road has a 60mph speed limit, with one lane in either direction, no central barrier, or anything to separate both lanes.
attributes.additional_details:
Something needs to be done to change the design of this road. It is a danger to the public. Why is there a dual carriageway all along the A34, yet when you arrive to Melrose Way, it is nothing short of a single lane motorway - expect there is nothing to separate cars travelling in opposite directions.

Let's start something positive, and get this road made safer through having a central barrier.

Please sign and share your support.

attributes.action: Create Licenses and Rules for Pet Stores to sell and abide by for Reptiles.
attributes.background: I believe Pet Stores should have to have a specialist license to be able to keep and sell reptiles as well as having frequent checks by a specialist team such as the RSPCA. Stores having the correct information will create a better understanding for owners on what is correct for these creatures.
attributes.additional_details:
Reptiles vary in what type of care they need aren't pets for the amateurs. Some need at least UVA and UVB lighting together whilst some may need alot more specialist equipment. 
Recently Pets at Home have stopped selling Reptiles due to complaints. Many Reptiles sold have became ill or mis-sold wrong information. Which had led to an large amount of unexpected vet fees; a bad environment for these reptiles.

attributes.action: Do Not lower ANY food safety standards to obtain trade deals with any country.
attributes.background: There is a very real risk in order to obtain trade deals the government could change our food safety standards for the worse once we have left the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Such things as food grown with currently banned pesticides, genetically modified foods (particularly unlabeled), chlorine/acid washed chicken, hormone/antibiotic growth promoters and animal by-products being fed back to livestock are all risks. All are not currently allowed here but all happen in the US and other countries


The UK  must not allow our food safety laws to be lowered, they MUST not be relaxed in order to obtain any trade deal.

attributes.action: Get Deaf Road Warning signs onto our streets.
attributes.background: I am the mother of a 9 year-old profoundly Deaf boy. It struck me when visiting Europe and my family in the US that many countries and states have Deaf road warning signs in areas near schools with Deaf children and young adults, as well as in the vicinity of homes with Deaf families.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. There are 11 million people with hearing loss across the UK, around one in six of the population. Deafness is the third most common disability in the world but you probably wouldn't spot a Deaf person in a crowd or know that a pedestrian has hearing loss.
The DSA handbook has warning signs for many things, deer crossing elderly people, schools and so on. A Deaf road warning sign is a glaring omission.

attributes.action: Make asking for sex or sexual acts for rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: UK landlords are using classified adverts to advertise 'Sex for Rent' arrangements, in which young, vulnerable, often homeless people are convinced into living with a landlord "rent" free, in exchange for sexual acts. This coercion cannot continue, particularly for those with no other choice.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is effectively incitement to prostitution and should be classified as such under Section 52 of the Sexual Offenders Act 2003. 
(https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/prostitution-and-exploitation-prostitution) 

For more information please watch this documentary:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p05y93q5

 Or read these articles:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/d6ad2e6d-2c72-4a35-9281-daaeedf029ee
https://www.rt.com/uk/384580-sex-abuse-rent-tenants/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to label non-racist people as racist.
attributes.background: I am tired of non-racist people being called racist and groups against terrorism being labelled as racist.  Racism is justifiably a serious offence and calling people racist when it's unjust and untrue should be considered just as serious an offence.

attributes.action: Make NHS prescriptions and healthcare free for all Universal Credit claimants
attributes.background: Universal Credit claimants are being denied the free prescriptions and NHS dental care they are entitled to because doctors and dentists don't know whether they are eligible for it. Claimants for some of the benefits included in Universal Credit are entitled to free healthcare while others aren't.
attributes.additional_details:
This government’s incompetent handling of the move to Universal Credit is leaving many people already struggling with their finances, including people legally entitled to free dental care and prescriptions, going without the treatment they need because they can't afford to pay for it.

No one in Britain should have to go without healthcare because they can't afford it. Prescriptions and all NHS treatment should be free to anyone claiming Universal Credit. More information at http://bit.ly/2yzForA

attributes.action: FREE Junior use of council sports fields/ pitches and a cap on the Adult price.
attributes.background:
Get the Government to make local sports fields/pitches owned by local councils FREE for use by junior sports teams (Under 18) and immediate Cap on the cost for Adult sport teams. 
Councils are looking to earn money Instead of keeping our society fit and healthy!
SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S HEALTH!
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds City Council’s Charges risen by 15.9% in 5 years.

2012/13 season... 
Adults: £521 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £191 per team, per pitch

2017-18 season current charges.. 
Adults: £604 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £221 per team, per pitch
Mini: £110 per team, per pitch

The prices charged for pitches in Leeds goes up most years', meaning less Children can get involved with their local sports club as the price becomes a barrier for some families, especially those on low incomes or benefits

attributes.action: Introduce specialist juries for rape trials, not random jurors
attributes.background: Specialist juries who understand how complex and serious rape is could prevent mistrials and mean that more rapists are found guilty. They should be introduced in rape cases to protect victims and make sure rapists go to prison.
attributes.additional_details:
A rape trial case went for retrial as a juror got arrested with drugs. Second jury chose to help defendant and defendants' barrister was more prepared.

Victim had ribs broken. She had been controlled, bullied and traumatised. She had to go through two rape trials. Defendant had no witnesses in original trial, but had four in last trial. Victim was bullied in court by barrister. It was horrific, not justice.

attributes.action: Change the crime of killing by drink driving to manslaughter.
attributes.background:
My dad at 13 years old lost his mother because someone got behind the wheel after drinking. This person served less than 3 years in prison.
Drink driving fits the definition of manslaughter, they may mean no malice but knowing the risk still choose to drive, so should be punished accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
Causing death due to drink driving in the UK is sentenced as death by dangerous driving. The average custodial sentence for causing death by careless/dangerous driving was just under four years in 2015.
240 times a year someone is killed by a drink driver in the UK. This means nearly 5 times a week someone in the UK loses their mom, dad, child, partner or friend.
Being in a vehicle makes their sentence more lenient than manslaughter. That is not justice for those who lose their lives.

attributes.action: Make it law for all companies to plant three trees for every one they cut down.
attributes.background: Deforestation is happening at an unsustainable rate. Not only is it putting the survival of millions of species at risk but is also accelerating the effects of global warming. The best way to combat this is for every company trading in the UK to plant at least three trees for every one it cuts down.
attributes.additional_details:
"Many of the world’s most threatened and endangered animals live in forests, and 1.6 billion people rely on benefits forests offer, including food, fresh water, clothing, traditional medicine and shelter." "Some 46-58 thousand square miles of forest are lost each year—equivalent to 48 football fields every minute." https://www.worldwildlife.org/threats/deforestation#
"Deforestation is responsible for nearly 20 per cent of global carbon emissions." https://www.forestry.gov.uk/forestry/infd-7m8mnm

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: To introduce an annual dementia screening test for everyone over the age of 45.
attributes.background: Dementia is the major cause of death in England and Wales and, due to the aging population and more awareness of this disease, is set to become the UK's biggest killer. Earlier diagnosis and treatment can slow down the disease and help to improve the sufferer's quality of life.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/info/20056/our_care_and_cure_research_magazine/971/dementia_research_news_-_spring_2017/4

attributes.action: Ban import and export of wild animals and their skins/fur
attributes.background: I love animals, always have and always will, and think it is cruel to kill for their skin when underneath there was a mind and soul even more beautiful that its spotty fur. Also, shipping them away from their natural habitats for someone else's entertainment is horrible.

attributes.action: Stop! No prisoners should be allowed to have the vote
attributes.background: The Government is planning to give some prisoners the vote. The Government should hold firm and not back down to the ECHR. Prisoners lose their right to vote by committing crimes. This is a bonkers decision. The decision should be for UK parliament, not the ECHR. No prisoners should have the vote.

attributes.action: Withdraw the UK from the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We need to restore common sense to our country. It is time to put Britain first. We need a British Bill of Rights and Responsibilities. The formal link between the British Courts and the European Court of Human Rights needs to be broken.
attributes.additional_details: The Supreme Court should be the ultimate arbiter of human rights matters in the UK

attributes.action: Expel Venezuelan Diplomats and close their Embassy in London
attributes.background: Venezuela is acting like a rogue state. Its citizens are being denied their basic rights and it’s been linked with narco-trafficking and the sales of passports to the black market. Due to the economic meltdown in Venezuela there is a high risk to UK citizens allowing Venezuelan diplomats in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Venezuelan Diplomats should be expelled and the Embassy in London closed to avoid risk to the UK:

https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/terrorism 

https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b090fb4z/hardtalk-isaias-medina-minister-counsellor-of-venezuela-to-the-un-20152017 

http://edition.cnn.com/2017/04/07/americas/venezuela-government-workers-syrian-passport-sales/index.html 

https://www.europarltv.europa.eu/programme/world/sakharov-prize-2017-venezuela-s-opposition-in-a-crisis-struck-country

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in schools as part of the RE curriculum
attributes.background: Paganism is still being ignored by the curriculum despite being one of the oldest religions in the world and a religion from which many newer religions have borrowed traditions. Paganism is at the heart of British history and should be taught to allow understanding of our heritage to UK children.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.

attributes.action: Raise at the UN Security Council the  police violence against the Catalan people
attributes.background: The widespread police violence against civilians trying to hold a referendum vote today is an insult to democracy in Western Europe and requires a proper UK response. We have a Responsibility To Protect where a state allows its own people to be treated like this

attributes.action: fitting of dash cams in vehicles to be mandatory
attributes.background: If this were a legal requirement in accidents where there are no witnesses it could provide vital information for the police and families, shorten investigation times therefore saving money & resources and act as a deterrent for reckless behaviour

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Waive liability of dog owners when an intruder is attacked in the home.
attributes.background: It seems there is a lot of confusion and unclear legislation regarding ‘liability’ if an intruder is bitten by a dog in the dogs home? This needs clarifying urgently along with clarity in respect to signage placed at the property, it should also be legislated in the view of protecting non criminals.
attributes.additional_details: A dog is naturally territorial although a lot of breeds, usually smaller would not attack an intruder due to size difference, a lot of perfectly well rounded large breeds would indeed feel threatened by an intruder entering ‘their’ secure territory. I am an ex British Army dog handler and find it abhorrent that the government cannot back up its citizens in a way they should. A person can be educated on the laws of ‘minimum force deemed necessary’ but how do you teach a dog not to defend itself.

attributes.action: Encourage Banks to form a marketplace in our communities for general services.
attributes.background: Banks need to consider how best to meet the continuing needs of households and businesses alike. There should be a marketplace in our towns where Banks can maintain a presence together which would be beneficial to those customers who prefer or need a face to face service.
attributes.additional_details: The Financial Conduct Authority have already logged my comments on this matter and will consider it in their on going regulation of the banking markets. The infirm/disabled, those lacking confidence on line, those with poor broadband provision or requiring to bank coin; cannot be done at any mobile banking alternative. All of these will be severely impacted upon should the trend of Bank closures continue.

attributes.action: Make all types of packaging 100% recyclable or biodegradable
attributes.background: All forms of packaging for every type of product made within, imported to or exported from the UK should be 100% recyclable or biodegradable

attributes.action: Make the misuse of a disabled parking bay a criminal offence.
attributes.background: It common to find, usually expensive cars using disabled bays without having a right to a Blue Badge.
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of facebook pages dedicated to bad parking which lists hundreds of cars in disabled bays not displaying a blue badge.

attributes.action: Sanction the South African Government, if it fails to act on all farm murders.
attributes.background: Farmers are being slaughtered, the SA government isn't providing adequate measures to prevent it. UK citizens either residing in or having families abroad are concerned about safety and request support in the form of sanctions if they continue not to act.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/23/british-woman-killed-south-africa-robbers-torture-blow-torch/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QU93hQjV8GE

attributes.action: Debate the competence of the Prime Minister
attributes.background: The recent Florence speech by the Prime Minister has not fulfilled or satisfied the democratic outcome on membership of the EU membership referendum.  The wishes of the majority vote are not being supported by the Government.
attributes.additional_details: Given the history of other referendums concerning the EU, there is suspicion that delaying cpmplete separation from the EU, will in effect generate apathy in the electorate and result fudge and further compromise, even another referendum to keep UK in the EU. This completely contradicts the wishes of the majority who voted to leave.  The consequences of Government prevarication on this matter, will dilute and further diminish the right of the the Government to govern the governed. We the people, have no trust or confidence, in the competence of Theresa May to govern the UK satisfactorily.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of fingerprint scanners to police
attributes.background: The Home Office is beginning a trial of new fingerprint scanners with West Yorkshire Police. These scanners connect to an app on a police officer's phone, allowing quick checking of the person's fingerprints against criminal and immigration databases. This has not had any parliamentary scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/police-trial-new-home-office-mobile-fingerprint-technology

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/news/blog/why-its-not-okay-police-quietly-roll-out-spot-fingerprint-scanning

attributes.action: Ban ALL formulas on public sale that contain microbeads.
attributes.background: The government is banning the use of microbeads in "Rinse off" products. The cosmetic companies complain that to reformulate all their products which contain microbeads would mean changing 90% of their formulas. So government's ban only covers 10% of the use of microbeads.

attributes.action: Ban animals in circuses across England
attributes.background: Scotland has done it, why hasn’t Theresa May helped animals in England? It’s barbaric, outdated and starves animals of natural instincts.

attributes.action: All schools to offer optional sessions so children can learn about growing food
attributes.background:
In the UK we've a proud heritage in the growing of our food. Be it on farms, allotments or in our gardens. 

Sadly though, many children haven't had the pleasure of harvesting their own veg for their plate. 

We feel that children need access to areas to experience growing food for themselves.

attributes.action: Make it law for all UK citizens to carry a identity card.
attributes.background: Carrying identity cards would help to prevent non UK residents using our NHS without paying for the service, and also stop people getting benefits when they are not entitled.

attributes.action: Require shops to make all aisles wide enough for wheelchairs, scooters and prams
attributes.background: Stores are packed with as many goods as possible, regardless of the store size. Unfortunately, this means the aisle space between goods can be very small. For those in wheelchairs, using scooters, or pushing a pram, this proves to be a real problem. This is an example of indirect discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: Small aisle space can be perceived as being off-putting, embarrassing and offensive for those who are unable to move through the space with ease. This not only can have a negative impact on a personal level, but also on the store itself as some may be put off from shopping there again. We do not tend to have this issue with supermarkets due to their traditional layout of wide aisles. This petition hopes to raise awareness, whilst asking for policy to be introduced to tackle the problem.

attributes.action: stop charging the public 15p to call the non-emergency 101 line
attributes.background: young man knocking on my door at 1.15am. Tried ringing 999. when man walked off rang local police station and was told to ring 101 which I did. After 15 minutes with no reply rang off but was charged 15p. I think it wrong that we are charged for ringing the police

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable plastics for single use items
attributes.background: Most single use plastics take over a century to decomposes which is causing a large issue when trying to dispose of it. Non-biodegradable plastics build up in our landfill sites, rivers and oceans affecting a number of bird and marine species. So why not just make single use plastics biodegradable?
attributes.additional_details:
Biodegradable plastics are a better alternative to non-biodegradable plastics because they can be recycled, reused and require less energy to produce.   
We must look to a better and more sustainable future,
Please sign this petition and let’s take action!

attributes.action: The Government must fully protect the UK's fishing rights in talks with the EU.
attributes.background: Michael Gove “One of the things about leaving the EU is it means we’re free of the Common Agricultural Policy, free of the Common Fisheries Policy, able to have higher environmental and higher animal welfare standards." Mrs May.. “When we leave the EU, we will be leaving the Common Fisheries Policy.
attributes.additional_details:
From the Daily Express Newspaper. 

"EU officials appear to be targeting the UK’s fishing rights and want to use that as a bargaining chip in the talks in return for progress in other areas where Britain would require market access.

One unnamed EU diplomat told the Financial Times: “The UK government will ultimately need to decide how much it wants to pay to make the fish dream come true.”

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: Stop UK foreign aid to all countries that mistreat minorities in appalling ways.
attributes.background:
Spending of foreign aid has to be used to the benefit of all citizens. Countries, such as Pakistan, that continue to mistreat their minorities must not receive aid any longer: 
Asia Bibi, Christian mother of five, in prison for alleged blasphemy since 2010. 
Ahmadi mosque attacked, Chakwal, 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
References:
Asia Bibi:
bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-38222680
Ahmadi mosque attack:

barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#india
Afghan ex-Muslim persecuted:
youtube.com/watch?v=Tr_VGtTV8yY

attributes.action: Christmas items must not be advertised, stocked or displayed before December
attributes.background: It should be law for any businesses not to advertise, stock or sell any Christmas related items
attributes.additional_details: It is currently September and we can see Christmas items before Halloween items or Firework items

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK abolishing the Monarchy and becoming a Republic
attributes.background: A Monarchy that receives taxpayers' money is an anachronism in a modern democracy. A referendum should be held to ascertain whether the British people are prepared to continue to pay for this archaic institution.

attributes.action: To create correct training for police who investigate rape allegations.
attributes.background:
Too many rape victims have been let down by our justice system. They themselves are made to feel like it was their fault, or they were in the wrong. 
This is not right. Do victims of theft find themselves being treated the same way?
attributes.additional_details:
70% Of women will not report a rape. 
Conviction rates for rape are far lower than other crimes, with only 5.7% of reported rape cases ending in a conviction for the perpetrator.
Correct training needs to be provided for police officers who investigate rape allegations, so these victims can be treated with respect, listened to and helped.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for immigration to the UK like Australia based on work skills
attributes.background: To enter Austrailia to live you must apply and are considered based on the contribution you can make to the country. Each applicant should be able and expected to work and priority is given to applicants who are qualified in emplyment areas which we are lacking applicants

attributes.action: Extortionate TV charges for hospital patients to be stopped. Free TV in hospital
attributes.background: Ill patients are being charged extortionate prices for TV while in hospital. An example of this an 77 year old with learning disabilities who has been in hospital for two wks has been charged over 100 pounds to watch TV. They can not read a book or play on their Ipad due to being illiterate.
attributes.additional_details:
What is this doing to their mental health and wellbeing? 
How is it fair to charge someone who is ill and on a low income 10 pound a day to watch TV. 
There are so many elderly patients waiting to be able to go home but can't until they are assessed and a care plan has been put in place. This can take months. Mental health becomes effected and the risk of catching something else could cause a longer stay in hospital. Please sign to help make hospital TV free.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public&private holiday services to be under an ombudsman
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for providers of holidays whether it be a public or private service,to be under an ombudsman. This allows there to be a fair and impartial assessment of dispute cases to stop those acting independently from treating customers unfairly when they are not willing to negotiate.

attributes.action: Compulsory liability insurance for dog owners, criminal offence to leave scene
attributes.background:
It is law if you damage someone's property they are entitled to compensation. 
If my dog is attacked by another dog then it's owner should pay my vet bills. It should be a criminal offence for them not to give their details. The incident/history should then be reported/recorded to authorities/vets.
attributes.additional_details:
Records of how many times dog has attacked. The owner should be made to take dog to behavioural or correction training or the dog would need to be controlled on lead or muzzled in public. 
Medical insurance should be owners choice but insurance to cover your dog attacking another dog/person compulsory. It protects both parties from expensive vet/claim costs. 
We have compulsory car insurance. Dogs feel pain, trauma and so does the owner seeing their pet attacked.
Please support.
